result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin M Krueger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting >$5000-$10,000, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Sentence may be transferred to Clark County - State of Washington

miscConds.notes:
Fine to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Restitution to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
DNA to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
Maintain full time employment and/or combination of schooling.

Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with clean harbors environmental services or any of it's employees.
No employment directly handling any money or credit cards.
Provide DNA Sample if not already.
Defendant to report to Waukesha Sheriff'sdept within 3 business days to provide DNA Sample.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Justin M Krueger in court with attorney Nathan John Dineen. Lesli Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State is requesting restitution in the amount of $8,289.80. Defense has no objection to this amount. Court orders restitution set at $8,289.80. The amount is already indicated in the Judgment of Conviction.
Restitution hearing on May 6, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
filed by the State
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Justin M Krueger in court with attorney Nathan John Dineen.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty. Court will set a restitution hearing in 30 days to see if Clean Harbor requests to pursue further restitution. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- Sentence withheld for  3 years Probation - sentence may be transferred to Clark County - State of Washington
- Fine totaling $1548.00  to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- Restitution of $8,289.80 to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Conditions of  Probation:  Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.   Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling or any other approved activity by agent. No contact with clean harbors environmnetal services or any of it's employees. No employment directly headling any money or credit cards.  DNA Sample if not yet provided. Defendant to report to the Waukesha County Sheriff Department within (3) business days to  provide a DNA sample.
 -  6 months jail Condition Time with huber (nonworking hours) commencing FORTHWITH. Non working hours with standard release conditions. Sentence may be transferred to Clark County in the State of Washington. No Electronic Monitoring.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 1, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Request for adjournment filed by defendant/defense counsel
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 12, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
